alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 08 at 7:21PM MST until March 10 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Snowy Range, Sierra Madre Range, Northern Laramie Range. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible mountain travel due to icy, snow packed roads and very low visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation including hiking and snow mobiling could be hazardous to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Very low wind chills can lead to frost bite and hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: North Laramie Range; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range
